sys_embedded_help_content.content:
Chart Colors list

Report administrators can change the look of charts by specifying colors used to represent specific report data categories.

Click the column headers to search, sort, filter, and edit data.

The Chart Colors list has the following columns:
  • Name Table used for the report.
    Note: The list shows only tables and database views that are in the same scope as the chart colors record.
  • Color – Hexadecimal value used to specify a color that is not already defined in the Color Definition module.
  • Color name – Color name, as defined in the Color Definition module. When a report is generated, this color is used to represent the specified value.
  • Display – A bar in the color defined by hexadecimal value indicated in the Color or Color name field.
  • Element – Column name specific to the selected table.
  • Value – Value for which the specified color should be displayed.
  • Updated – The date and time the color was last modified.
Related information
Application scope
